answers.author: Eric Eddy
answers.text:
Patrick,
I know the City of Lakeland, FL maintains Bryant Stadium that the local high school team(s) play in, and they just replaced the natural grass with field turf at a significant cost.  I believe they were able to determine the O&M costs associated with a natural field vs. a artificial surface made the expenditure worthwhile. You can see the new field from Google Maps if you zoom in on the satellite view far enough. 
The Parks & Rec director is named Bob Donahay, and he probably wouldn't mind speaking with you. There is something strange going on with their website right now, but the link to their department is http://www.lakelandgov.net/parkrec/Home.aspx

text: How many local governments are responsible for the maintenance of a stadium for your local high schools?  That includes purchasing new artificial turf and replacing in when it has reached the end of its useful life.
title: Stadium Management
